page.title: 14RELIGION CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: Holmsted Manor,between Staplefield and Whitemans Green,built in 1891 on the site of an older house,has been priv- ate residence,school and country club. Since 1976 it has been training head- quarters of Youth with a Mission foun- ded in America but now international. The aim is to train young people in Christian discipleship,to practice in their lives when they leave.Young men and women of many nationalities come, and receive Bible teaching and are ta- ught many aspects of Christian work. They take part in missions at home and abroad,worship and assist with Sunday School at Slaugham church.After train- ing they go on to work with drug add- icts,refugees or homeless etc. They have two ships used for mercy missions, and run a drama company called Street-lights.
